glsa.title: MediaWiki: Cross-site scripting vulnerability
glsa.synopsis: MediaWiki is vulnerable to a cross-site scripting attack that could allow arbitrary JavaScript code execution.

background.p: MediaWiki is a collaborative editing software, used by big projects like Wikipedia.

description.p: MediaWiki fails to escape a parameter in the page move template correctly.

impact.p: By enticing a user to visit a specially crafted URL, a remote attacker could exploit this vulnerability to inject malicious JavaScript code that will be executed in a user's browser session in the context of the vulnerable site.

workaround.p: There is no known workaround at this time.

resolution.p: All MediaWiki users should upgrade to the latest available version:
